claim: In 2010, posts with no more than two answers saw an average of 8.666666666666666 links created per month.
extra_info: calculation = DIVIDE(COUNT(Id where YEAR(CreationDate) = 2010 and AnswerCount < = 2), 12)
reasoning: The query counts postLinks records created in 2010 where the linked post has AnswerCount <= 2, yielding 104 links. Dividing by 12 months gives 8.6667, which matches the claimed value of 8.666666666666666.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me first explore the database schema, then run the appropriate query.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE postLinks
(
    Id            INTEGER      not null
        primary key,
    CreationDate  DATETIME null,
    PostId        INTEGER      null,
    RelatedPostId INTEGER      null,
    LinkTypeId    INTEGER      null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (RelatedPostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

            on update cascade on delete cascade,

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
Now I understand the schema. The claim is about "links created per month" in 2010 for posts with no more than two answers. Based on the hint, the calculation is: COUNT of postLinks records where the related post has AnswerCount <= 2 and the link was created in 2010, divided by 12.

Let me re-read the hint more carefully. The hint says: `DIVIDE(COUNT(Id where YEAR(CreationDate) = 2010 and AnswerCount <= 2), 12)`. The "Id" here likely refers to postLinks.Id, with the CreationDate from postLinks and AnswerCount from posts.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(pl.Id) FROM postLinks pl JOIN posts p ON pl.PostId = p.Id WHERE strftime('%Y', pl.CreationDate) = '2010' AND p.AnswerCount <= 2;"
input.description: Count links in 2010 for posts with AnswerCount <= 2

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT CAST(COUNT(pl.Id) AS REAL) / 12 FROM postLinks pl JOIN posts p ON pl.PostId = p.Id WHERE strftime('%Y', pl.CreationDate) = '2010' AND p.AnswerCount <= 2;"

content.text:
The result is 104 / 12 = 8.66666666666667, which matches the claimed value of 8.666666666666666 (the difference is just floating-point representation).
